commit_message:
Fix ctlplane-ip-range validations

The `undercloud.conf` file has now 2 sections (DEFAULT and ctlplane-subnet).
A small numbers of parameters have been deprecated and moved to the
ctlplane-subnet section. Morever, the `undercloud_conf` custom plugin has some
issues to generate facts coming from the 'undercloud.conf' file due to the new
section.

This patch proposes to use the 'ini' custom plugin to get parameter's values
from the undercloud.conf file instead of using the 'undercloud_conf' custom
plugin.

Resolves: rhbz#1660075

Change-Id: I7689e1c8f7f44058b0ad44318c5eef522ddfad52
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5417bbdf43952d99667ffe41349174a4fc4072fe)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/95/664495/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name: Check the number of IP addresses available for the overcloud nodes - name: Get dhcp_start value from the undercloud.conf file ini: path: "{{ tripleo_undercloud_conf_file }}" section: ctlplane-subnet key: dhcp_start ignore_missing_file: True register: dhcp_start - name: Get dhcp_end value from the undercloud.conf file become: true ini: path: "{{ tripleo_undercloud_conf_file }}" section: ctlplane-subnet key: dhcp_end ignore_missing_file: True register: dhcp_end start: "{{ dhcp_start.value|default('192.0.2.5') }}" end: "{{ dhcp_end.value|default('192.0.2.24') }}"
deleted_lines: name: Check the number of IP addresses available to overcloud nodes - name: Gather undercloud.conf values undercloud_conf: undercloud_conf_path={{ tripleo_undercloud_conf_file }} ignore_missing=true start: "{{ undercloud_conf.DEFAULT.dhcp_start|default('192.0.2.5') }}" end: "{{ undercloud_conf.DEFAULT.dhcp_end|default('192.0.2.24') }}"

commit_message:
Remove deprecated Ram/Disk filters in scheduler_default_filters

After https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565841 when using these
Filters nova is not scheduling to the ironic nodes and overcloud
deployment fails.

Ram/Disk Filters are not required when using filter_scheduler.

Since stable/queens doesn't have containerized undercloud, need
to remove from instack-undercloud.

Ram/Disk filters are deprecated in [1].
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/596502/

Change-Id: I2515438c5ca80758be173523b0bf4c031b54706f
Related-Bug: 1787910
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/24/664524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add passphrase generation for Octavia

A recent change[1] to Octavia added a parameter named
server_certs_key_passphrase, which means that we should generate a
password for it to avoid using the default value.

This patch adds OctaviaServerCertsKeyPassphrase to the list of
generated password/secrets, similarly to this past change[2].

Closes-Bug: #1821756
Related-Bug: #1821751

[1] I06d329ca53bc36bd27f7870ae7c7ca0cf18575b2
[2] I1dd1873b646e8569ed0a85c5ee7eb3bec3a8b1fa

Change-Id: I9699961faf8b3430e4372e4ff3ae2bf7e7ceea18
(cherry picked from commit da967dd80bcca8966581444417ad7cb27d7e60ba)

commit_message:
Add passphrase generation for Octavia

A recent change[1] to Octavia added a parameter named
server_certs_key_passphrase, which means that we should generate a
password for it to avoid using the default value.

This patch adds OctaviaServerCertsKeyPassphrase to the list of
generated password/secrets, similarly to this past change[2].

Closes-Bug: #1821756
Related-Bug: #1821751

[1] I06d329ca53bc36bd27f7870ae7c7ca0cf18575b2
[2] I1dd1873b646e8569ed0a85c5ee7eb3bec3a8b1fa

Change-Id: I9699961faf8b3430e4372e4ff3ae2bf7e7ceea18
(cherry picked from commit da967dd80bcca8966581444417ad7cb27d7e60ba)

commit_message:
DVR neutron template should enable ARP responder

If a cluster with dvr is deployed with tripleo template, arp responder
is not enabled, but it should be.  This enables it.

Closes-Bug: #1831798
Change-Id: I28a040993669ad6446026e41274b0460d5f9eebc
(cherry picked from commit 90ecca6f6fd26bcbea0831ba53058ee4a925f77d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/44/664044/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
DVR neutron template should enable ARP responder

If a cluster with dvr is deployed with tripleo template, arp responder
is not enabled, but it should be.  This enables it.

Closes-Bug: #1831798
Change-Id: I28a040993669ad6446026e41274b0460d5f9eebc
(cherry picked from commit 90ecca6f6fd26bcbea0831ba53058ee4a925f77d)

commit_message:
Add access alias (aka) for the resource attributes

In the compute.server we are currently exposing names, which are only 
"aliases" for known attributes (i.e. accessIPv4 vs access_ipv4). Since 
we want to drop the _normalization completely it is necessary to expose 
attributes under old used names (which are not really fitting naming 
convention of the resource attributes). So add a "aka" to the 
BaseComponent.
While we are here 
- repair some of the resource accesses from the unittests (i.e. direct 
conversion to dict), 
- update local dict storage, so that json.dumps works on update 
resource. Actually also fix the existing problem in the code with that.
- add _attributes_iterator to de-duplicate logic in Resource
- what a wonderful bug - passing sha256 as md5 (affects nodepool 
heavily). Add also tests for that.

Change-Id: I39edfc8fe4e4f6c216663c0e7602c9f1bec5cab4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/46/663846/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, name, type=None, default=None, alias=None, aka=None, :param aka: If set, additional name attribute would be available under. self.aka = aka # Placeholder for aliases as dict of {__alias__:__original} _attr_aliases = {} for attr, component in self._attributes_iterator(): if component.aka: # Register alias for the attribute (local name) self._attr_aliases[component.aka] = attr @classmethod def _attributes_iterator(cls, components=tuple([Body, Header])): """Iterator over all Resource attributes """ # isinstance stricly requires this to be a tuple # Since we're looking at class definitions we need to include # subclasses, so check the whole MRO. for klass in cls.__mro__: for attr, component in klass.__dict__.items(): if isinstance(component, components): yield attr, component try: return object.__getattribute__(self, name) except AttributeError as e: if name in self._attr_aliases: # Hmm - not found. But hey, the alias exists... return object.__getattribute__( self, self._attr_aliases[name]) raise e def __iter__(self): # This wonderful method is invoked when we access Resource as a dict # One of the examples is in unittests # (self.assertDictEqual(expected, dict(Resource)) for key in self._attributes(): yield key, getattr(self.__class__, key) if not real_item and name in self._attr_aliases: # Not found? But we know an alias exists. name = self._attr_aliases[name] real_item = getattr(self.__class__, name, None) def _attributes(self, remote_names=False, components=None, include_aliases=True): """Generate list of supported attributes """ attributes = [] if not components: components = tuple([Body, Header, Computed, URI]) for attr, component in self._attributes_iterator(components): key = attr if not remote_names else component.name attributes.append(key) if include_aliases and component.aka: attributes.append(component.aka) return attributes # NOTE(gtema) For now let's return list of 'public' attributes and not # remotes or "unknown" underlying_keys = self._attributes() for key, value in cls._attributes_iterator(component): # Make sure base classes don't end up overwriting # mappings we've found previously in subclasses. if key not in mapping: # Make it this way first, to get MRO stuff correct. mapping[key] = value.name for attr, component in self._attributes_iterator(components): if original_names: key = component.name else: key = attr for key in filter(None, (key, component.aka)): # Make sure base classes don't end up overwriting # mappings we've found previously in subclasses. if key not in mapping: value = getattr(self, attr, None) if ignore_none and value is None: continue if isinstance(value, Resource): mapping[key] = value.to_dict(_to_munch=_to_munch) elif isinstance(value, dict) and _to_munch: mapping[key] = munch.Munch(value) elif value and isinstance(value, list): converted = [] for raw in value: if isinstance(raw, Resource): converted.append( raw.to_dict(_to_munch=_to_munch)) elif isinstance(raw, dict) and _to_munch: converted.append(munch.Munch(raw)) else: converted.append(raw) mapping[key] = converted else: mapping[key] = value dict.update(self, self.to_dict())
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, name, type=None, default=None, alias=None, return object.__getattribute__(self, name) underlying_keys = itertools.chain( self._body.attributes.keys(), self._header.attributes.keys(), self._uri.attributes.keys(), self._computed.attributes.keys()) # Since we're looking at class definitions we need to include # subclasses, so check the whole MRO. for klass in cls.__mro__: for key, value in klass.__dict__.items(): if isinstance(value, component): # Make sure base classes don't end up overwriting # mappings we've found previously in subclasses. if key not in mapping: # Make it this way first, to get MRO stuff correct. mapping[key] = value.name # Since we're looking at class definitions we need to include # subclasses, so check the whole MRO. for klass in self.__class__.__mro__: for attr, component in klass.__dict__.items(): if isinstance(component, components): if original_names: key = component.name else: key = attr # Make sure base classes don't end up overwriting # mappings we've found previously in subclasses. if key not in mapping: value = getattr(self, attr, None) if ignore_none and value is None: continue if isinstance(value, Resource): mapping[key] = value.to_dict(_to_munch=_to_munch) elif isinstance(value, dict) and _to_munch: mapping[key] = munch.Munch(value) elif value and isinstance(value, list): converted = [] for raw in value: if isinstance(raw, Resource): converted.append( raw.to_dict(_to_munch=_to_munch)) elif isinstance(raw, dict) and _to_munch: converted.append(munch.Munch(raw)) else: converted.append(raw) mapping[key] = converted else: mapping[key] = value

subject: Set xenapi_use_agent to "False" instead of false

commit_message:
Set xenapi_use_agent to "False" instead of false

The correct remote value is "False". It's supposed to be a string.
Set it that way.

Story: #2005851
Task: #33637
Change-Id: I44b6fc9fe12422024392d60573862a646046564a

commit_message:
Added sink unit tests

We had no coverage of the base sink. This add some basic
tests, as well as a fake notification handler that can be
used for testing.

Change-Id: Ie8657aacd22737f9ebaac4af4b34030e12ab18d0

commit_message:
Support devstack's global virtualenvs

Devstack may be moving to global virtualenvs due to cahnges in upstream
python package tooling that make it impractical to continue installing
all of the packages against the system python. Instead we use global
virtualenvs which give us coinstallation testing but require we
explicitly support things in funny paths.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/558930
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/559811
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/559856
Change-Id: I6f62da4d521494dfd6caba8098682a6558a32126

added_lines: # We enable devstack's new virtualenv support feature. export GLOBAL_VENV="True" # More bootstrapping. To use the global virtualenvs we need to find # out where they live. DEVSTACK_VENV2=$(set +o xtrace && source $BASE_DEVSTACK_DIR/stackrc && echo $DEVSTACK_VENV2) DEVSTACK_VENV3=$(set +o xtrace && source $BASE_DEVSTACK_DIR/stackrc && echo $DEVSTACK_VENV3) # Make sure we configure the necessary virtualenvs setup_devstack_virtualenvs

commit_message:
Remove glean config for OVH nodes

OVH updated its infra in order to have correct network_data.json given
by metadata API and / or config drive.

So glean override for this is not needed anymore.

Change-Id: Id97aceb78019b7b71bc231778d7ea7e0f3964e0d
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-06-07 16:46:47.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/encryptors/luks.py', 'os_brick/tests/encryptors/test_luks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/d7f9ff61fb5854fd17c2d713ecd60654d1c9a452', 'message': 'luks: Default to LUKS v1 when formatting volumes

cryptsetup 2.0.6 has started to default to LUKS v2 or LUKS2 when
formatting volumes.  However QEMU currently has no support for v2 and
will fail to open the volume when being used to natively decrypt.

For now we should default the original LUKS encryptor to v1 when
formatting volumes, introducing a new LUKS2 encryptor and encryption
constant in a future change.

Closes-bug: 1831994
Change-Id: I152fe10ff5a3131950b789d3fd4efa15c554ff09
(cherry picked from commit 94312bd90fe42a870b4f098e00ddd9ff2aacd1bb)

commit_message:
luks: Default to LUKS v1 when formatting volumes

cryptsetup 2.0.6 has started to default to LUKS v2 or LUKS2 when
formatting volumes.  However QEMU currently has no support for v2 and
will fail to open the volume when being used to natively decrypt.

For now we should default the original LUKS encryptor to v1 when
formatting volumes, introducing a new LUKS2 encryptor and encryption
constant in a future change.

Closes-bug: 1831994
Change-Id: I152fe10ff5a3131950b789d3fd4efa15c554ff09
(cherry picked from commit 94312bd90fe42a870b4f098e00ddd9ff2aacd1bb)

commit_message:
Change host for osapi and metadata services in db.

Currently db records for nova-osapi_compute and nova-metadata
services in nova.services table takes host value from osapi_compute_listen
and metadata_listen options from nova.conf. This patch changes that value
to hostname.

Closes-Bug: #1631430

Change-Id: I484a2b70e2a5513200f75a436c964f89f0467c84

commit_message:
Devstack-gate changes to enable n-api on subnode

Enable n-api on subnode in multinode environment to test
zero downtime upgrade when DEVSTACK_GATE_NOVA_ENABLE_API_SUBNODE
is set.

Change-Id: I1b257cfe7c6aec7f999824a1510b4edc63167e80

commit_message:
Add post hook script to run tempest with old n-api

This script tests if old n-api is compatible with new controller services
which is needed to prove zero downtime upgrade process.

During the zero downtime upgrade process, old n-api should communicate
well with new controller services. This script tests this scenario.

This script is called in zero-downtime-upgrade experimental gate job and
is tested in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/419066/. In the gate job,
after grenade upgrades the controller node, this script is called to
change nova endpoint to n-api on the subnode and run tempest smoke tests.

Change-Id: I7ac4744927395e300205e0f2283b7f2828f431d6
Depends-On: I1b257cfe7c6aec7f999824a1510b4edc63167e80
Co-Authored-by: Anusha Unnam <anusha.unnam@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/95/401395/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Change nova api endpoint to old api and run # tempest tests in multi api environment. set -xe cd $BASE/new/tempest source ~/devstack/functions-common source $BASE/new/nova/nova/tests/live_migration/hooks/utils.sh primary_node=$(cat /etc/nodepool/primary_node_private) SUBNODES=$(cat /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private) function create_end_point { openstack endpoint create $1 --region $2 --publicurl $3 --internalurl $4 --adminurl $5 } function create_region_two { source $BASE/new/devstack/openrc for SUBNODE in $SUBNODES; do nova list echo $SUBNODE SERVICE_HOST="http://$SUBNODE" REGION_NAME='RegionTwo' create_end_point "compute" "$REGION_NAME" "$SERVICE_HOST:8774/v2.1" \ "$SERVICE_HOST:8774/v2.1" "$SERVICE_HOST:8774/v2.1" create_end_point "image" "$REGION_NAME" "$SERVICE_HOST:9292" \ "$SERVICE_HOST:9292" "$SERVICE_HOST:9292" create_end_point "identity" "$REGION_NAME" "$SERVICE_HOST/identity" \ "$SERVICE_HOST/identity" "$SERVICE_HOST/identity_v2_admin" create_end_point "compute_legacy" "$REGION_NAME" "$SERVICE_HOST:8774/v2/\$(project_id)s" \ "$SERVICE_HOST:8774/v2/\$(project_id)s" "$SERVICE_HOST:8774/v2/\$(project_id)s" create_end_point "volume" "$REGION_NAME" "$SERVICE_HOST:8776/v1/\$(project_id)s" \ "$SERVICE_HOST:8776/v1/\$(project_id)s" "$SERVICE_HOST:8776/v1/\$(project_id)s" create_end_point "volumev2" "$REGION_NAME" "$SERVICE_HOST:8776/v2/\$(project_id)s" \ "$SERVICE_HOST:8776/v2/\$(project_id)s" "$SERVICE_HOST:8776/v2/\$(project_id)s" create_end_point "volumev3" "$REGION_NAME" "$SERVICE_HOST:8776/v3/\$(project_id)s" \ "$SERVICE_HOST:8776/v3/\$(project_id)s" "$SERVICE_HOST:8776/v3/\$(project_id)s" done } # Add RegionTwo in keystone catalog with n-api pointing to subnode create_region_two # Change region in tempest, neutron and cinder conf files. $ANSIBLE primary --sudo -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m ini_file \ -a "dest=$BASE/new/tempest/etc/tempest.conf section=identity option=region value=RegionTwo" $ANSIBLE primary --sudo -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m ini_file \ -a "dest=/etc/cinder/cinder.conf section=DEFAULT option=os_region_name value=RegionTwo" $ANSIBLE primary --sudo -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m ini_file \ -a "dest=/etc/neutron/neutron.conf section=nova option=region_name value=RegionTwo" # Run tempest tests run_tempest "Tempest tests with old api"

commit_message:
Set IRONIC_USE_MOD_WSGI False for target

It helps don't use uwsgi functionality for the ironic-api service
the default.

Change-Id: I301c1eb2a95460bc261f1cdaf539abeee23d6b62

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.

commit_message:
Switching to python 3 with the docs build

As latest Sphinx is requiring python 3 this patch sets basepython to
python 3 in the [testenv] section of tox.ini to make sure that is what
the environment is using so we don't need to pin the Sphinx version.

Change-Id: I217ee30359719ab3793b1329ec5e3f1a03848b8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/95/664595/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove unused tools/tox_install.sh

This file is unused and unneeded, remove it.

Change-Id: Ib640408b10e04e1132a807cfc489f0f10633b291
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/45/663245/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/usr/bin/env bash # Client constraint file contains this client version pin that is in conflict # with installing the client from source. We should remove the version pin in # the constraints file before applying it for from-source installation. CONSTRAINTS_FILE="$1" shift 1 set -e # NOTE(tonyb): Place this in the tox enviroment's log dir so it will get # published to logs.openstack.org for easy debugging. localfile="$VIRTUAL_ENV/log/upper-constraints.txt" if [[ "$CONSTRAINTS_FILE" != http* ]]; then CONSTRAINTS_FILE="file://$CONSTRAINTS_FILE" fi # NOTE(tonyb): need to add curl to bindep.txt if the project supports bindep curl "$CONSTRAINTS_FILE" --insecure --progress-bar --output "$localfile" pip install -c"$localfile" openstack-requirements # This is the main purpose of the script: Allow local installation of # the current repo. It is listed in constraints file and thus any # install will be constrained and we need to unconstrain it. edit-constraints "$localfile" -- "$CLIENT_NAME" if [ -z "$@" ]; then echo "No packages to be installed." exit 0 fi pip install -c"$localfile" -U "$@" exit $?
